Package voltage.processors

Class BiQuadFilter

java.lang.Object
voltage.processors.BiQuadFilter
public class BiQuadFilter
extends java.lang.Object
A bi-quad filter class This is a second order recursive linear filter, containing two poles and two zeros. "Biquad" is an abbreviation of "biquadratic", which refers to the fact that in the Z domain, its transfer function is the ratio of two quadratic functions

  • Constructor Details

    • BiQuadFilter

      public BiQuadFilter​(BiQuadFilter.FilterType type, double frequency, double gain)
      Constructor for a BiQuadFilter
      Parameters:
      type - the filter type.
      frequency - the filter freqency. Valid ranges are 0 to 24,000.
      gain - the amount of gain to add/remove. ( 1.0 is no gain.)

    • BiQuadFilter

      public BiQuadFilter​(BiQuadFilter.FilterType type, double frequency, double gain, double bandwidth)
      Constructor for a BiQuadFilter
      Parameters:
      type - the filter type.
      frequency - the filter freqency. Valid ranges are 0 to 24,000.
      gain - the amount of gain to add/remove.
      bandwidth - . 1.0 = 1 octave. 2.0 = 2 octaves and so on.

    • SetdBGain

      public void SetdBGain​(double gain)
      Sets the gain for the filter. Filters typically remove some of the energy. This helps to account for that.
      Parameters:
      gain - the amount of gain to set. 1.0 would be no change.

    • GetdBGain

      public double GetdBGain()
      Gets the filter's gain.
      Returns:
      the gain being used.
